Project Name: Second Costa Rica Disaster Risk Management Development Policy Loan with a Cat DDO
Trigger from Loan/Financing Agreements: No withdrawal shall be made of the Single Withdrawal Tranche unless the Bank is satisfied, based on evidence satisfactory to it, that a State of Emergency (Estado de Energencia) has been declared by the Borrower through an executive decree to respond to an occurring natural catastrophe.
Additional Information from Minutes & Pr: Drawdown trigger. Funds may be drawn upon the declaration of a State of Emergency in part or all of the Costa Rican territory, as a result of an occurring catastrophe generated by natural phenomena or health related events under terms and conditions specified in the Loan Agreement. The declaration of a State of Emergency in Costa Rica is a power of the Executive (Presidency of the Republic) in accordance with the National Emergencies and Riks Prevention Law No. 8488 of 2006 (Ley Nacional de Emergencias y Prevención del Riesgo No. 8488 de 2006). This declaration allows by way of exception, the actions, and the allocation of the necessary resources to attend to the emergency, in accordance with article 180 of the Political Constitution. As such, declarations of State of Emergency translate into emergency plans, usually with a duration of up to five years, which are developed under the responsibility of the CNE and incorporate the necessary investments to repair and rebuild damaged infrastructure and goods. The legal framework for declaring an emergency due to natural hazards and health-related events remains unchanged since the first DPL with Cat DDO and has continued to function well, including for the response to COVID-19, which was coordinated by the CNE and financed through the emergency fund mechanisms.
